text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale, on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen, I'm going to show

you how I like to make a cannoli dip, two
different flavors.

I'm going to do a traditional cannoli dip
flavor and I'm going to do an almond chocolate
flavor.

Now, you love cannoli, I love cannoli, but
the truth is, I don't know if it's the pregnancy

or what but the idea of having to fill like
20 mini cannoli shells just kind of sends

me over the edge, so I figured a dip would
be a fantastic option if you're having a get

together especially right now if you're doing
a back to school or you have people coming

over or you have a neighborhood fall party,
just any gathering where you want to put something
together that people will love.

And trust me, people will love these recipes
like you would not believe, and they're so
simple and easy - I mean, they're perfect.

So let me run you through the list of ingredients
you are going to need.

What I have here is some cream cheese that
I have softened, whole milk, ricotta, you

need some confectioner's sugar, this is some
ground cinnamon, you can't see because it's

clear but a little bit of almond extract,
unsweetened cocoa powder, vanilla, an orange,

you'll also need some mini semi-sweet chocolate
chips and anything you want to use as your
dipper.

What I like to use is actually pieces of cannoli,
they're called cannoli chips.

They sell them in my regular grocery store,
it's basically like a cannoli - a cannoli

shell but instead of them forming it into
a shell, they form it into little chips.

So it's beautiful, it's easy to use but you
could also use pizzelles if you have those,

goodness, really anything, you could use whatever
your heart desires, you could use waffle cones,
broken up into pieces, have fun, be playful!

Alright, let's get started, now my cream cheese
has been softened at room temperature but

I want to whip this up a bit so I'm just going
to use my handy dandy little mixer here and
I'm just going to let it mix for about a minute.

Awesome, now traditional cannoli filling doesn't
require any cream cheese.

I like to add it into a dip because it makes
it super creamy.

I think that if you are not going to have
it in the cannoli shell, if you're just using

ricotta and that's it, it might just seem
a little bit too thin, a little too runny

and almost a little too flavorless, if you
will.

So by adding the cream cheese, you're adding
lots of thickness, you're adding lots of really

good flavor, so I think it's really important
to add it here.
And your confectioners sugar.

These are going to be the three ingredients
that are going to be the base, so I'm going

to whip these up, I'm going to whip it - going
to whip it real good, for about a minute.

This looks pretty fantastic, I want to point
just one thing out because I do think it's

important, you have to use whole milk ricotta,
don't try to use low fat and don't try to

use part skim, because your filling will be
too thin and runny.

So, whole milk, if you're going to make it,
make it all the way.

I'm going to split this into two, I'm going
to take half of this mixture and add it to

my cocoa powder and set that aside and I'm
going to use half for my traditional flavor.

Okay, so what I'm going to do, just going
to take this all from the sides of the bowl.

of vanilla, make sure you buy the good stuff,
or you can make it your own if you've got
the time.

If I could get this open it would be a lot

A little vanilla, let those vanilla beans
run through.

And a little bit of orange zest, and the reason
I like to add orange zest is because in traditional
cannoli, we and by we I mean my family.

I've always eaten them with candied citrus
running through it, it's hard to fine, candied

citrus rinds are really hard to find so for
me I just find it easier to add a little bit

of orange zest and I'm telling you it does
the job super super well and it works every

time and you don't have to worry about buying
a little ten dollar container of candied orange

that you're never going to use again, so this
works just as well, smells fantastic it's

exactly what I'm looking for so this is the
traditional, I'm going to set it aside.

Okay, so now I'm going to work on my chocolate,
now the cocoa powder is going to give me some

really intense chocolate but I am going to
add in some chocolate chips in a little bit

because that's how mamma rolls, but to this
I'm going to add just a little bit of almond

extract, tony, tiny bit goes a long way and
it gives you a completely different flavor,

it's really fun, I mean you don't have to
add it if you don't want to you can do vanilla

and chocolate but just a little tiny bit really
makes it unexpected and elevates the whole

thing so I'm going to add some in and just
patiently I'm going to blend it into my filling.

And because no cannoli filling is complete
without lots of chopped chocolate, I like

to use mini chocolate chips, you can fold
some in too which would be amazing and I would
definitely suggest you do that.

But really this is it, if you have the time
which I do think it's beneficial, pop these

into the fridge for about an hour or so that
